text: [Music]
[Music]
hello i'm anushri a cloud support
engineer here at the aws office in
portland today i'm going to show you how
to view the status of an alarm in the
cloudwatch alarm history so that you can
troubleshoot why a customer did not
receive an amazon simple notification
service notification when the cloudwatch
alarm was triggered let's get started
after logging into the aws management
console navigate to the cloudwatch
console then on the navigation pane
under alarms choose all alarms
select the appropriate alarm and then
scroll below to view the history i have
a cloud watch alarm that i created for
this test let's check why the trigger
action failed as we can see the alarm
history displays a message
this shows that the trigger action
failed due to sns access policy
restrictions
this means that currently the cloudwatch
alarms service doesn't have permissions
to publish messages to the sns topic and
this causes the trigger to fail let's
check the policy to add appropriate
permissions navigate to sns console and
then choose the appropriate sns topic
under access policy let's add the
required permissions
i manually triggered the alarm now we
can see the sns notification now let's
take a look at another scenario of why
the trigger failed
let's look at this error it looks like
the trigger action failed due to sns
encryption this error message shows that
the sns is being encrypted let's take a
look at the encryption options at the
sns
go to the sns console
choose the appropriate topic
when we look under encryption we see
it's configured
and for customer managed key we see the
value as alias slash aws slash sns this
indicates that this is an aws managed
key and not a customer managed key using
this key policy prohibits cloudwatch
alarms from publishing messages to the
sns topic this means that if the sms
topic must be encrypted at rest make
sure that you use a customer managed key
if the trigger action succeeded an alarm
history displays a message
then this shows that the cloudwatch
alarm successfully published a message
to the sns topic and yet you didn't
receive a notification
if you didn't receive notification then
the next step is to check the sns topic
and its metrics for delivery failures by
following the associated knowledge
center article
we have looked at the various scenarios
where the sns notification was not
received even though the cloudwatch
alarm was triggered and shown you how to
resolve these errors
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at aws
[Music]
you
